quote: Death consists, indeed, in a repeated process of unrobing, or unsheathing. The immortal part of man shakes off from itself, one after the other, its outer casings, and - as the snake from its skin, the butterfly from its chrysalis - emerges from one after another, passing into a higher state of consciousness.
author: Annie Besant

quote: If any foreign minister begins to defend to the death a 'peace conference', you can be sure his government has already placed its orders for new battleships and airplanes.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: Over the centuries, mankind has tried many ways of combating the forces of evil... prayer, fasting, good works and so on. Up until Doom, no one seemed to have thought about the double-barrel shotgun. Eat leaden death, demon.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Sickness, insanity and death were the angels that surrounded my cradle and they have followed me throughout my life.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: Where is the politician who has not promised to fight to the death for lower taxes- and who has not proceeded to vote for the very spending projects that make tax cuts impossible?
author: Barry Goldwater

quote: You hear a lot about God these days: God, the beneficent; God, the all-great; God, the Almighty; God, the most powerful; God, the giver of life; God, the creator of death. I mean, we're hearing about God all the time, so we better learn how to deal with it. But if we know anything about God, God is arbitrary.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: Sleep is the interest we have to pay on the capital which is called in at death; and the higher the rate of interest and the more regularly it is paid, the further the date of redemption is postponed.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The stroke of death is as a lover's pinch, which hurts and is desired.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: No society has been able to abolish human sadness, no political system can deliver us from the pain of living, from our fear of death, our thirst for the absolute. It is the human condition that directs the social condition, not vice versa.
author: Eugene Ionesco

quote: In fact, for all kinds of offenses - and, for no offenses - from murders to misdemeanors, men and women are put to death without judge or jury; so that, although the political excuse was no longer necessary, the wholesale murder of human beings went on just the same.
author: Ida B. Wells

quote: I intend to leave after my death a large fund for the promotion of the peace idea, but I am skeptical as to its results.
author: Alfred Nobel

quote: I felt I did trust in Christ, Christ alone for salvation, and an assurance was given me that he had taken away my sins, even mine, and saved me from the law of sin and death.
author: John Wesley

quote: I need good friends who can say, 'I love you to death, but you look terrible in that, and you need to change right now.'
author: Blake Lively

quote: The Gross National Product includes the destruction of the redwoods and the death of Lake Superior. It grows with the production of napalm and missiles and nuclear warheads... It includes... the broadcasting of television programs which glorify violence to sell goods to our children.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Death is not the end. There remains the litigation over the estate.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: We are not victims of aging, sickness and death. These are part of scenery, not the seer, who is immune to any form of change. This seer is the spirit, the expression of eternal being.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: There's no tragedy in life like the death of a child. Things never get back to the way they were.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: No evil is honorable: but death is honorable therefore death is not evil.
author: Citium Zeno

quote: To have the truth in your possession you can be found guilty, sentenced to death.
author: Peter Tosh

quote: Death seems to provide the minds of the Anglo-Saxon race with a greater fund of amusement than any other single subject.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: My children are magical creatures and I love them to death.
author: Jack Black

quote: I went to medical school because I wanted to ask the big questions. Do we have a soul? Does God exist? What happens after death?
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: If you followed the media you'd think that everybody in Africa was starving to death, and that's not the case; so it's important to engage with the other Africa.
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

quote: In Christ we see a maturity of love that flowers in self-sacrifice and forgiveness; a maturity of power that never swerves from the ideal of service; a maturity of goodness that overcomes every temptation, and, of course, we see the ultimate victory of life over death itself.
author: Vincent Nichols

quote: Are you not moved to tears and bitter compassion, when you behold the only Son of God seized by the most impious, dragged away, mocked, scourged, buffeted, spit upon, crowned with thorns, hung upon the infamous cross between two thieves, finally in such a horrible and execrable manner suffering death, for your salvation and that of the world?
author: Peter Abelard

quote: One must keep working continuously; otherwise, one thinks of death.
author: Enzo Ferrari

quote: You can't call it an adventure unless it's tinged with danger. The greatest danger in life, though, is not taking the adventure at all. To have the objective of a life of ease is death. I think we've all got to go after our own Everest.
author: Brian Blessed

quote: Working with the dying is like being a midwife for this great rite of passage of death. Just as a midwife helps a being take their first breath, you help a being take their last breath.
author: Ram Dass

quote: Surely martyrs, irrespective of the special phase of the divine idea for which they gladly give up their bodies to torture and to death, are the truest heroes of history.
author: Katharine Lee Bates

quote: Epigenetics doesn't change the genetic code, it changes how that's read. Perfectly normal genes can result in cancer or death. Vice-versa, in the right environment, mutant genes won't be expressed. Genes are equivalent to blueprints; epigenetics is the contractor. They change the assembly, the structure.
author: Bruce Lipton

quote: Death has its revelations: the great sorrows which open the heart open the mind as well; light comes to us with our grief. As for me, I have faith; I believe in a future life. How could I do otherwise? My daughter was a soul; I saw this soul. I touched it, so to speak.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: I didn't attend the funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I am prepared to meet my Maker. Whether my Maker is prepared for the great ordeal of meeting me is another matter.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I don't believe in death, neither in flesh nor in spirit.
author: Bob Marley

quote: I feel monotony and death to be almost the same.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: For me, life and death are very important themes. There is no life without death. That's why it's very important to me.
author: Tite Kubo

quote: Bankruptcy is about financial death and financial rebirth. Bankruptcy is the great American story rewritten. We're a nation of debtors.
author: Elizabeth Warren

quote: What an encouraging thought that Jesus - our beloved Husband - can find comfort in our lowly feeble gifts! Can this be, for it seems far too good to be true? May we then be willing to endure trials or even death itself if through these hardships we are assisted in bringing gladness to Immanuel's heart.
author: Charles Spurgeon

quote: Life levels all men. Death reveals the eminent.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Let us all be brave enough to die the death of a martyr, but let no one lust for martyrdom.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Prohibit the taking of omens, and do away with superstitious doubts. Then, until death itself comes, no calamity need be feared.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: As far as songwriting, my inspirations came from love, life and death, and viewing other people's situations.
author: Ed Sheeran

quote: And how can man die better than facing fearful odds, for the ashes of his fathers, and the temples of his Gods?
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: Anyone who supports terrorism, anyone who sees terrorism as a legitimate means, anyone who uses terrorism to cause the death of innocent people is a terrorist in my eyes.
author: Milos Zeman

quote: The safest course is to do nothing against one's conscience. With this secret, we can enjoy life and have no fear from death.
author: Voltaire

quote: One death is a tragedy one million is a statistic.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: Loss and possession, death and life are one, There falls no shadow where there shines no sun.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: At that time I had complete confidence in Russian policy and I believed that the Western Allies deliberately allowed Russia and Germany to fight each other to the death.
author: Klaus Fuchs

quote: I'm not afraid of death, but I'm in no hurry to die. I have so much I want to do first.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: Land and sea, weakness and decline are great separators, but death is the great divorcer for ever.
author: John Keats

quote: A face to lose youth for, to occupy age With the dream of, meet death with.
author: Robert Browning

quote: The acceptance of death gives you more of a stake in life, in living life happily, as it should be lived. Living for the moment.
author: Sting

quote: I offer neither pay, nor quarters, nor food; I offer only hunger, thirst, forced marches, battles and death. Let him who loves his country with his heart, and not merely with his lips, follow me.
author: Giuseppe Garibaldi

quote: A country that relies on aid? Death is better than that. It stops you from achieving your potential, just as colonialism did.
author: Imran Khan

quote: One is still what one is going to cease to be and already what one is going to become. One lives one's death, one dies one's life.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.
author: Albert Pike

quote: I'll sleep when I'm dead.
author: Warren Zevon

quote: For death is no more than a turning of us over from time to eternity.
author: William Penn

quote: If your best friend has stolen your girlfriend, it does become life and death.
author: Ben Kingsley

quote: We will all, someday, experience death, and become obsolete as a dead leaf falling from a tree, crushed by passersby to ashes underlying the earth.
author: Kim Elizabeth

quote: Perhaps grief is not about empty, but full. The full breath of life that includes death. The completeness, the cycles, the depth, the richness, the process, the continuity and the treasure of the moment that is gone the second you are aware of it.
author: Alysia Reiner

quote: Everything one does in life, even love, occurs in an express train racing toward death. To smoke opium is to get out of the train while it is still moving. It is to concern oneself with something other than life or death.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Death is just life's next big adventure.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: Communism possesses a language which every people can understand - its elements are hunger, envy, and death.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: My life is fair game for anybody. I spent an unhappy, penniless childhood in Brooklyn. I had to slug my way up in a town called Hollywood where people love to trample you to death. I don't relax because I don't know how. I don't want to know how. Life is too short to relax.
author: Susan Hayward

quote: Racism and injustice and violence sweep our world, bringing a tragic harvest of heartache and death.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Sometimes, how you ingest this idea of masculinity as projected onto you by the world could be the difference of life and death.
author: Barry Jenkins

quote: Look, I don't want to wax philosophic, but I will say that if you're alive you've got to flap your arms and legs, you've got to jump around a lot, for life is the very opposite of death, and therefore you must at very least think noisy and colorfully, or you're not alive.
author: Mel Brooks

quote: We sometimes congratulate ourselves at the moment of waking from a troubled dream it may be so the moment after death.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: When life is victorious, there is birth; when it is thwarted, there is death. A warrior is always engaged in a life-and-death struggle for Peace.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: I support the death penalty. But I also think there has to be no margin for error.
author: George Ryan

quote: Death may be the King of terrors... but Jesus is the King of kings!
author: Dwight L. Moody

quote: The world is put back by the death of every one who has to sacrifice the development of his or her peculiar gifts to conventionality.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: Once you start doing only what you've already proven you can do, you're on the road to death.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: As a parent, it's my responsibility to equip my child to do this - to grieve when grief is necessary and to realize that life is still profoundly beautiful and worth living despite the fact that we inevitably lose one another and that life ends, and we don't know what happens after death.
author: Sam Harris

quote: True love makes the thought of death frequent, easy, without terrors; it merely becomes the standard of comparison, the price one would pay for many things.
author: Stendhal

quote: Smoking is the now the principal avoidable cause of premature death in Britain. It hits the worst off people hardest of all. Smoking is one of the principal causes of the health gap which leads to poorer people being ill more often and dying sooner.
author: Frank Dobson

quote: The Goddess of Old Europe and Ancient Crete represented the unity of life in nature, delight in the diversity of form, the powers of birth, death and regeneration.
author: Carol P. Christ

quote: There is no fundamental difference between the preparation for death and the practice of dying, and spiritual practice leading to enlightenment.
author: Stanislav Grof

quote: Since 1957, black people have experienced double-digit unemployment - in good times and bad times. Look at the population of African Americans in prison. They represent more than half the population of prisoners in the country, 55 percent of those on death row.
author: Danny Glover

quote: The best news of the Christian gospel is that the supremely glorious Creator of the universe has acted in Jesus Christ's death and resurrection to remove every obstacle between us and himself so that we may find everlasting joy in seeing and savoring his infinite beauty.
author: John Piper

quote: I think that beauty can injure you to death. It can cause an injury that can never be cured. Or it can so traumatise you, your life changes direction. The beauty of the harmony of nature that is forever lost, or a daily rite that you perform, or diving into the sea for a swim. Those experiences are going to mark you.
author: Toni Servillo

quote: The glories of our blood and state, Are shadows, not substantial things; There is no armour against fate, Death lays his icy hand on kings. Scepter and crown must tumble down, And, in the dust, be equal made With the poor crooked scythe and spade.
author: James Shirley

quote: Of all the gods only death does not desire gifts.
author: Aeschylus

quote: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there's no risk of accident for someone who's dead.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I have never killed a man, but I have read many obituaries with great pleasure.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: I decided to devote my life to telling the story because I felt that having survived I owe something to the dead. and anyone who does not remember betrays them again.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: Those who have the strength and the love to sit with a dying patient in the silence that goes beyond words will know that this moment is neither frightening nor painful, but a peaceful cessation of the functioning of the body.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.
author: Euripides

quote: Men fear death as children fear to go in the dark; and as that natural fear in children is increased by tales, so is the other.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: I'm gonna live till I die.
author: Frank Sinatra

quote: I've looked that old scoundrel death in the eye many times but this time I think he has me on the ropes.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: Death is a delightful hiding place for weary men.
author: Herodotus

quote: Pale Death beats equally at the poor man's gate and at the palaces of kings.
author: Horace

quote: If physical death is the price that I must pay to free my white brothers and sisters from a permanent death of the spirit, then nothing can be more redemptive.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Someone has to die in order that the rest of us should value life more.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Even at our birth, death does but stand aside a little. And every day he looks towards us and muses somewhat to himself whether that day or the next he will draw nigh.
author: Robert Bolt

quote: We should weep for men at their birth, not at their death.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: Not the torturer will scare me, nor the body's final fall, nor the barrels of death's rifles, nor the shadows on the wall, nor the night when to the ground the last dim star of pain, is hurled but the blind indifference of a merciless, unfeeling world.
author: Roger Waters

quote: Death is the golden key that opens the palace of eternity.
author: John Milton

quote: Creation destroys as it goes, throws down one tree for the rise of another. But ideal mankind would abolish death, multiply itself million upon million, rear up city upon city, save every parasite alive, until the accumulation of mere existence is swollen to a horror.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: It comes with faith, for with complete faith there is no fear of what faces you in life or death.
author: Jacqueline Cochran

quote: I could not tell you the date of my mother's death. I could not tell you the date of my dad's death. These are not dates that I find significant.
author: O. J. Simpson

quote: There are, as is known, insects that die in the moment of fertilization. So it is with all joy: life's highest, most splendid moment of enjoyment is accompanied by death.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Good is positive. Evil is merely privative, not absolute: it is like cold, which is the privation of heat. All evil is so much death or nonentity. Benevolence is absolute and real. So much benevolence as a man hath, so much life hath he.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A pun does not commonly justify a blow in return. But if a blow were given for such cause, and death ensued, the jury would be judges both of the facts and of the pun, and might, if the latter were of an aggravated character, return a verdict of justifiable homicide.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: All violence consists in some people forcing others, under threat of suffering or death, to do what they do not want to do.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Take care of your life and the Lord will take care of your death.
author: George Whitefield

quote: O Death, rock me asleep, bring me to quiet rest, let pass my weary guiltless ghost out of my careful breast.
author: Anne Boleyn

quote: I mean, whatever kills you kills you, and your death is authentic no matter how you die.
author: Jerry Garcia

quote: Death is pitch-dark, but colors are light. To be a painter, one must work with rays of light.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: Death doesn't frighten me now I can think peacefully of ending a long life.
author: Jeanne Calment

quote: As long as your body is healthy and under control and death is distant, try to save your soul; when death is immanent what can you do?
author: Chanakya

quote: Everything tends to make us believe that there exists a certain point of the mind at which life and death, the real and the imagined, past and future, the communicable and the incommunicable, high and low, cease to be perceived as contradictions.
author: Andre Breton

quote: If we can understand that death is not the end but is really a transition into the next life, the great part of life, that frees us up into receiving God's courage and his help.
author: Max Lucado

quote: Just like the poles of a magnet, some people are drawn to death and others are repulsed by it, but we all have to deal with it.
author: James Hetfield

quote: Stories hold conflict and contrast, highs and lows, life and death, and the human struggle and all kinds of things.
author: David Lynch

quote: He that fears death loses the joys of life.
author: Jan Hus

quote: I will never be a fan of any kind of political correctness: I think it's instant death to creativity.
author: Mads Mikkelsen

quote: There can be no darker or more devastating tragedy than the death of man's faith in himself and in his power to direct his future.
author: Saul Alinsky

quote: A weak soul does not have the endurance to resist the flesh for very long. It grows heavy, becomes flesh itself, and the contest ends. But among responsible men, men who keep their eyes riveted day and night upon the Supreme Duty, the conflict between flesh and spirit breaks out mercilessly and may last until death.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quote: Life is a banquet, and most poor suckers are starving to death.
author: Rosalind Russell

quote: It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure on the world.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Life can't defeat a writer who is in love with writing, for life itself is a writer's lover until death.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: Shrinking away from death is something unhealthy and abnormal which robs the second half of life of its purpose.
author: Carl Jung

quote: And why not death rather than living torment? To die is to be banish'd from myself And Silvia is myself: banish'd from her Is self from self: a deadly banishment!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Once you accept your own death, all of a sudden you're free to live. You no longer care about your reputation. You no longer care except so far as your life can be used tactically to promote a cause you believe in.
author: Saul Alinsky

quote: I know I'm drinking myself to a slow death, but then I'm in no hurry.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: If I think more about death than some other people, it is probably because I love life more than they do.
author: Angelina Jolie

quote: Do the thing we fear, and death of fear is certain.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: In our brief national history we have shot four of our presidents, worried five of them to death, impeached one and hounded another out of office. And when all else fails, we hold an election and assassinate their character.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: When I came back to Dublin I was courtmartialed in my absence and sentenced to death in my absence, so I said they could shoot me in my absence.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: Any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in Mankind; And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls; it tolls for thee.
author: John Donne

quote: One can survive everything, nowadays, except death, and live down everything except a good reputation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Mendacity is a system that we live in. Liquor is one way out an death's the other.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Death is a release from the impressions of the senses, and from desires that make us their puppets, and from the vagaries of the mind, and from the hard service of the flesh.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Sinful and forbidden pleasures are like poisoned bread; they may satisfy appetite for the moment, but there is death in them at the end.
author: Tryon Edwards

quote: It is old age, rather than death, that is to be contrasted with life. Old age is life's parody, whereas death transforms life into a destiny: in a way it preserves it by giving it the absolute dimension. Death does away with time.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Neither the sun nor death can be looked at with a steady eye.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: There is no such thing as inner peace. There is only nervousness or death. Any attempt to prove otherwise constitutes unacceptable behavior.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: The first requisite for immortality is death.
author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

quote: For days after death hair and fingernails continue to grow, but phone calls taper off.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: Whoever has the luck to be born a character can laugh even at death. Because a character will never die! A man will die, a writer, the instrument of creation: but what he has created will never die!
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: We know the road to freedom has always been stalked by death.
author: Angela Davis

quote: Between our birth and death we may touch understanding, As a moth brushes a window with its wing.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: You only live twice. Once when you are born and once when you look death in the face.
author: Ian Fleming

quote: Death is not the biggest fear we have our biggest fear is taking the risk to be alive - the risk to be alive and express what we really are.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quote: And now, once again, I bid my hideous progeny go forth and prosper. I have an affection for it, for it was the offspring of happy days, when death and grief were but words, which found no true echo in my heart.
author: Mary Shelley

quote: Live your life that the fear of death can never enter your heart.
author: Tecumseh

quote: The enemy fought with savage fury, and met death with all its horrors, without shrinking or complaining: not one asked to be spared, but fought as long as they could stand or sit.
author: Davy Crockett

quote: As I suffer in the defence of my Country, I must consider this hour as the most glorious of my life -Remember that I die as becomes a British Officer, while the manner of my death must reflect disgrace on your Commander.
author: John Andre

quote: The die is set and Malcolm will not escape for the foolish talk he spoke against his benefactor, such a man, is worthy of death, and it would have been so, were it not for Muhammad's confidence that God would give him the victory over the enemies.
author: Louis Farrakhan

quote: We will persevere, come life or death.
author: Lewis Tappan

quote: Life and death are important. Don't suffer them in vain.
author: Bodhidharma

quote: Give the peasants neither life nor death.
author: Ieyasu Tokugawa

quote: As far as thinking about death and murder and various ways of killing people and how people die... I probably have the most twisted mind in Slayer.
author: Tom Araya

quote: In this decisive hour of our national history, union means life and division means death.
author: Bao Dai

quote: Our faith is stronger than death, our philosophy is firmer than flesh, and the spread of the Kingdom of God upon the earth is more sublime and more compelling.
author: Dorothy Day

quote: Some words having to do with the death of the people in the World Trade Center attack had been added, and when I got to it, I had this overwhelmingly emotional experience. I struggled to get through the words; tears were streaming down my cheeks.
author: Leonard Nimoy

quote: And yet, I suppose you mourn the loss or the death of what you thought your life was, even if you find your life is better after. You mourn the future that you thought you'd planned.
author: Lynn Redgrave

quote: Additionally, this tax forces family businesses to invest in Uncle Sam rather than the economy. When families are forced to repurchase businesses because of the death tax, that means less money is being invested in new jobs and capital expansion.
author: Todd Tiahrt

quote: We do not celebrate the death of our enemies.
author: Yitzhak Rabin

quote: Fear of death increases in exact proportion to increase in wealth.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Death and vulgarity are the only two facts in the nineteenth century that one cannot explain away.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Death is really a great blessing for humanity, without it there could be no real progress. People who lived for ever would not only hamper and discourage the young, but they would themselves lack sufficient stimulus to be creative.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: Death is not the worst that can happen to men.
author: Plato

quote: Nothing is a matter of life and death except life and death.
author: Angela Carter

quote: I were better to be eaten to death with a rust than to be scoured to nothing with perpetual motion.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Bullfighting is the only art in which the artist is in danger of death and in which the degree of brilliance in the performance is left to the fighter's honor.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The call of death is a call of love. Death can be sweet if we answer it in the affirmative, if we accept it as one of the great eternal forms of life and transformation.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Nothing endears so much a friend as sorrow for his death. The pleasure of his company has not so powerful an influence.
author: David Hume

quote: Just as I shall select my ship when I am about to go on a voyage, or my house when I propose to take a residence, so I shall choose my death when I am about to depart from life.
author: Seneca

quote: Because of its tremendous solemnity death is the light in which great passions, both good and bad, become transparent, no longer limited by outward appearences.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: My mortal foe can no ways wish me a greater harm than England's hate neither should death be less welcome unto me than such a mishap betide me.
author: Elizabeth I

quote: The message that President Obama delivered in his speech at Notre Dame was: morality is immoral. Pro-life is the extremist position, not a moral position. Yet we should compromise and work to reduce abortions. Where's the compromise between life and death - and why work to reduce the number of them occurring if there's nothing wrong with them?
author: Rush Limbaugh

quote: Movies like that aren't about the visual effects and explosions. They're human stories about family, about life, about death.
author: Orlando Bloom

quote: I enjoy every climb - maybe it's because it's a literal dance between life and death.
author: Alain Robert

quote: Ultimately life is disease, death and oblivion. It's still better than high school.
author: Dan Savage

quote: Nobody with an IQ higher than emergency-room temperature could ever believe that 'death panels' would be appointed to nudge the elderly toward euthanasia. Yet for idle entertainment, it's hard to beat Sarah Palin's ignorant nattering on the subject.
author: Carl Hiaasen

quote: The rumors of my death have been greatly exaggerated.
author: Paul McCartney

quote: So here is one of my theories on happiness: we cannot know if we have lived a truly happy life until the very end. This view of life and death was reinforced by my close witnessing of the buildup to the death of Philip Gould. Philip was without doubt my closest friend in politics. When he died, I felt like I had lost a limb.
author: Alastair Campbell

quote: You know Americans are obsessed with life and death and rebirth, that's the American Cycle. You know, awakening, tragic, horrible death and then Phoenix rising from the ashes. That's the American story, again and again.
author: Billy Corgan

quote: The themes that make one laugh always stem from poverty, hunger, misery, old age, sickness, and death. These are the themes that make Italians laugh, anyway.
author: Mario Monicelli

quote: When I was younger, I wasn't concentrating on good days. I was managing a career and trying to have a good year. It would always 'lead' to something, which never leads to anything except death, where everything leads to. And then as I got older, and then I had my kids and everything, I began to appreciate a great Wednesday.
author: Albert Brooks

quote: I don't think people would climb mountains or jump off bridges with parachutes or kayak Class V rapids if those things didn't offer the brief and horrible illusion of imminent death. They would just be complicated, time-consuming endeavors that we'd steer well clear of because they got in the way of real life.
author: Sebastian Junger

quote: Birth, life, death is a cycle. And they're all beautiful, you celebrate all of them. Animals do grieve, but they move on. That's the lesson behind animals.
author: Cesar Millan

quote: Art is built on the deepest themes of human meaning: good and evil, beauty and ugliness, life and death, love and hate. No other story has incarnated those themes more than the story of Jesus.
author: John Ortberg

quote: I tend to think that good and evil exist and that the quantity in each of us is unchangeable. The moral character of people is set, fixed until death.
author: Michel Houellebecq

quote: Life and death matters, yes. And the question of how to behave in this world, how to go in the face of everything. Time is short and the water is rising.
author: Raymond Carver

quote: When we breathe it in, soot can interfere with our lungs and increase the risk of asthma attacks, lung cancer and even premature death. The smallest particles can pass into the blood stream and cause heart disease, stroke and reproductive complications.
author: Sheldon Whitehouse

quote: The Son of God took our nature, and in it took upon himself to teach us by both word and example even to the point of death, thus binding us to himself through love.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: The rise or fall of Shanghai means the birth or death of the whole nation.
author: Chiang Kai-shek

quote: I do fear death. But what I actually fear is not dying. I mean, true, it will be sad. But I know that there is a better place waiting for me.
author: Mattie Stepanek

quote: The language 'It's too late' is very unsuitable for most environmental issues. It's too late for the dodo and for people who've starved to death already, but it's not too late to prevent an even bigger crisis. The sooner we act on the environment, the better.
author: Jeremy Grantham

quote: They say death and taxes are the only things that are inevitable. The truth is, you can not pay your taxes. I've done it, and there's consequences, but it can be done. Death you're not going to get out of, and you kind of got to deal with it.
author: Steve Earle

quote: The tricks of magic follow the archetypes of narrative fiction - there are tales of creation and loss, death and resurrection, and obstacles that must be overcome.
author: Marco Tempest

quote: There is no such thing as death; life is only a dream, and we are the imagination of ourselves.
author: Bill Hicks

quote: In the early days of aviation, there was a great deal of experimentation and a high death rate.
author: Elon Musk

quote: Anorexia taught me to love life and to realise that starving yourself to death is a bloody waste of time. It's awful, and it hurts so many people around you. It's a terribly selfish thing to do.
author: Celia Imrie

quote: Death is present every day in our lives. It's not that I take pleasure in the morbid fascination of it, but it is a fact of life.
author: Jose Saramago

quote: I am not made for politics because I am incapable of wanting or accepting the death of the adversary.
author: Albert Camus

quote: I don't have any fear of death. I do, however, have an inordinate fear of becoming dependent on other people. To me, that's the severest test, not death.
author: Huston Smith

quote: WWI is a romantic war, in all senses of the word. An entire generation of men and women left the comforts of Edwardian life to travel bravely, and sometimes even jauntily, to almost certain death. At the very least, any story or novel about WWI is about innocence shattered in the face of experience.
author: Anita Shreve

quote: Death means change our clothes. Clothes become old, then time to come change. So this body become old, and then time come, take young body.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: When one is young, aspiring to play for the country, doing well, any hindrance, like injury or being out of form, can be frustrating and a cause of annoyance or even anger. But once you have a close encounter with death, you realise the real value of life.
author: Yuvraj Singh

quote: A martyr can never cooperate with death, go to death in a way that they're not trying to escape.
author: Stanley Hauerwas

quote: The most important part of the process of mourning is regularly reciting kaddish in a synagogue. Kaddish is a doxology, which Jewish tradition has mandated children to recite daily in a synagogue during the year of mourning for a deceased parent and then on the anniversary of his or her death thereafter.
author: David Novak

quote: I always get the 'goth girl' thing because I wear black. But I don't worship death.
author: Fairuza Balk

quote: Those who learned to know death, rather than to fear and fight it, become our teachers about life.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: While I understand the passions and the anger that arise over the death of Michael Brown, giving into that anger by looting or carrying guns, and even attacking the police, only serves to raise tensions and stir chaos.
author: Barack Obama

quote: If God is not sending earthquakes, destroying economies and inflicting pain upon human beings, what is God doing? God works through people, calling them to help their neighbors in need. God comforts His people, walking with them even 'through the valley of the shadow of death.'
author: Adam Hamilton

quote: The real kiss of death - particularly with my father - is the extraordinary popularity of his work.
author: Jamie Wyeth

quote: I always wanted to be the underdog. For me, as a portrait photographer, it's the kiss of death to become well known. I did my best work when no one knew who I was. People weren't threatened by me because they didn't think I was a big deal.
author: Platon

quote: Exile is like death. You cannot understand it until it happens to you.
author: Golshifteh Farahani

quote: For us, the death of Osama bin Laden is a time of profound reflection. With his death, we remember and mourn all the lives lost on September 11. We remember and mourn all the lives lost in Iraq, Afghanistan, Pakistan. We remember and mourn the death of our soldiers.
author: Jodie Evans

quote: I'm happy to stick with my persona. There are themes of love lost and love regained, but the main themes of all poems are basically love and death, and that seems to be the message of poetry.
author: Billy Collins

quote: Human nature stays the same, the one thing that stays constant, like death and taxes. And people still want good stories!
author: Alison Owen

quote: I wanted to acknowledge that life goes on but that death goes on, too. A person who is dead is a long, long story.
author: Elizabeth McCracken

quote: Movies make teenagers have quippy answers for every question. Nothing seems to faze them, and they're like, 'Oh, whatever.' You're not like that when you're a teenager. You're really earnest. Things really feel like life or death. And you kind of oscillate between emotions at one time. It's very emotionally draining being a teenager.
author: Bel Powley

quote: From my rotting body, flowers shall grow and I am in them and that is eternity.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: It's not life or death it's a game and at the end of the game there is going to be a winner and a loser.
author: Bernhard Langer

quote: Inactivity is death.
author: Benito Mussolini

quote: Smiles, tears, of all my life! - and, if God choose, I shall but love thee better after death.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: In this situation I was constantly exposed to danger and death.
author: Daniel Boone

quote: Disease, insanity, and death were the angels that attended my cradle, and since then have followed me throughout my life.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: Sometimes I wish my first word was 'quote,' so that on my death bed, my last words could be 'end quote.'
author: Steven Wright

quote: I think everyone understands grief, the journey it takes us on, whether it's the death of a loved one, the end of a relationship, a disappointment. Some people don't deal with it, the power of it. Some do. Some feel the weight of it and it informs their choices. I've had to open up to grief in different contexts.
author: Tori Amos

quote: It was a time when only the dead smiled, happy in their peace.
author: Anna Akhmatova

quote: The government is tottering. We must deal it the death blow an any cost. To delay action is the same as death.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: If I ever completely lost my nervousness I would be frightened half to death.
author: Paul Lynde

quote: Death wasn't part of God's original plan for humanity, and the Bible calls death an enemy - the last enemy to be destroyed.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Most single moms are very poor, uneducated, can't get a job, and if it weren't for government assistance, their kids would be starving to death and never have health care. And that's the story that we're not seeing, and it's unfortunate that we glorify and glamorize the idea of out of children wedlock.
author: Mike Huckabee

quote: Death is the prerequisite to resurrection, the new life God intends.
author: John Ortberg

quote: I wish to be a martyr, and I don't fear death.
author: Muqtada al Sadr

quote: Death is a distant rumor to the young.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: Life is fragile: it thrives only in a narrow range of temperatures between freezing and boiling. How lucky that our planet is just the right distance from the sun: a little farther, and the death of the perpetual Antarctic winter - or worse - would prevail; a little closer, and the surface would truly fry anything that touched it.
author: Leonard Susskind

quote: If you believe in God, believe in Death Row East.
author: Tupac Shakur

quote: No true believer could be intolerant or a persecutor. If I were a magistrate and the law carried the death penalty against atheists, I would begin by sending to the stake whoever denounced another.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: I hit rock bottom, but thank God my bottom wasn't death.
author: Stevie Ray Vaughan

quote: The closer we come to the negative, to death, the more we blossom.
author: Montgomery Clift

quote: Wild animals never kill for sport. Man is the only one to whom the torture and death of his fellow creatures is amusing in itself.
author: James Anthony Froude

quote: The destination is a happy life, an accomplished life that doesn't end with death but with eternal life.
author: Angelo Scola

quote: The common bees will never use their sting upon the queen; if she is to be disposed of, they starve her to death, and the queen herself will sting nothing but royalty, nothing but a rival queen.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Because I could not stop for death, He kindly stopped for me; The carriage held but just ourselves and immortality.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: A man must be willing to die for justice. Death is an inescapable reality and men die daily, but good deeds live forever.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: For centuries the death penalty, often accompanied by barbarous refinements, has been trying to hold crime in check; yet crime persists. Why? Because the instincts that are warring in man are not, as the law claims, constant forces in a state of equilibrium.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Personally, I would be delighted if there were a life after death, especially if it permitted me to continue to learn about this world and others, if it gave me a chance to discover how history turns out.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Yes, I support the death penalty. It is an issue that cannot be fudged or hedged.
author: Dianne Feinstein

quote: Death and genitals are things that frighten people, and when people are frightened, they develop means of concealment and aggression. It is common sense.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: Seeing that our thirst was increasing and the water was killing us, while the storm did not abate, we agreed to trust to God, Our Lord, and rather risk the perils of the sea than wait there for certain death from thirst.
author: Alvar N. C. de Vaca

quote: I have no fear of death. More important, I don't fear life.
author: Steven Seagal

quote: You can't reconcile being pro-life on abortion and pro-death on the death penalty.
author: N. T. Wright

quote: The two great risks are risking too much but also risking too little. That's for each person to decide. For me, not risking anything is worse than death. By far.
author: Jimmy Chin

quote: Watching a peaceful death of a human being reminds us of a falling star one of a million lights in a vast sky that flares up for a brief moment only to disappear into the endless night forever.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: If you think aficionados of a living Constitution want to bring you flexibility, think again. You think the death penalty is a good idea? Persuade your fellow citizens to adopt it. You want a right to abortion? Persuade your fellow citizens and enact it. That's flexibility.
author: Antonin Scalia

quote: There should be weeping at a man's birth, not at his death.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: Marriage is almost as old as dirt, and it was defined in the garden between Adam and Eve. One man, one woman for life till death do you part. So I would never attempt to try to redefine marriage. And I don't think anyone else should either. So do I support the idea of gay marriage? No, I don't.
author: Kirk Cameron

quote: If my survival caused another to perish, then death would be sweeter and more beloved.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Some people hate funerals. I find them comforting. They hit the pause button on life and remind us that it has an end. Every eulogy reminds me to deepen my dash, that place on the tombstone between our birth and our death.
author: Regina Brett

quote: 'Death at an Early Age' was about racial segregation in Boston. 'Illiterate America' was about grownups who can't read. 'Rachel and Her Children' was about people who were homeless in the middle of Manhattan.
author: Jonathan Kozol

quote: Death can never kill an idea. Ideas are more powerful than death. Ideas outlive men and can never be destroyed.
author: Myles Munroe

quote: If I die a violent death, as some fear and a few are plotting, I know that the violence will be in the thought and the action of the assassins, not in my dying.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: My character and good name are in my own keeping. Life with disgrace is dreadful. A glorious death is to be envied.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: In an artwork you're always looking for artistic decisions, so an ashtray is perfect. An ashtray has got life and death.
author: Damien Hirst

quote: I couldn't have foreseen all the good things that have followed my mother's death. The renewed energy, the surprising sweetness of grief. The tenderness I feel for strangers on walkers. The deeper love I have for my siblings and friends. The desire to play the mandolin. The gift of a visitation.
author: Mary Schmich

quote: Religion provides the only story that is fundamentally consoling in the face of the worst possible experiences - the death of a parent, for instance. In fact, many religions take away the problem entirely, because their adherents ostensibly believe that they're going to be reunited with everyone they love, and death is an illusion.
author: Sam Harris

quote: Puerto Ricans who find they can no longer afford to keep their pets often choose to drop their dogs, sometimes even whole litters of puppies, at a beach - sometimes under cover of night, in secret - rather than surrender the animal to a city or state-run shelter where the animals will face grim conditions and almost certain death by euthanasia.
author: Juliana Hatfield

quote: Everything about aging in my experience so far has been a plus. Except the death part!
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: The sinner who suddenly realizes God's love for him and then looks at his rejection of that love feels a loss similar to the death of a loved one. A deep void is created in the soul and a loneliness akin to the agony of death.
author: Mother Angelica

quote: Death is caused by swallowing small amounts of saliva over a long period of time.
author: George Carlin

quote: With actors, all our ages are out there for all to see - you can't hide anything, really. And it's kind of a relief. This is my age, this is what I look like without makeup on - who cares? That youth culture - that lying about your age - it's all denial of death anyway.
author: Julianne Moore

quote: I've said this over and over, but I'll say it a million more times - I'm concerned more about the death of a bee than I am about terrorism. Because we're losing hives and bees by the millions because of such strong pesticides.
author: Patti Smith

quote: I will admit, like Socrates and Aristotle and Plato and some other philosophers, that there are instances where the death penalty would seem appropriate.
author: Jack Kevorkian

quote: I won't forget the hood. I won't forget the days of catching a bullet on the way to the mailbox or bricks with death threats that somehow made their way through the window.
author: Pau Gasol

quote: There exists in some parts of the world sanctimonious criticism of America's death penalty, as somehow unworthy of a civilized society.
author: Antonin Scalia

quote: At a formal dinner party, the person nearest death should always be seated closest to the bathroom.
author: George Carlin

quote: The idea is to die young as late as possible.
author: Ashley Montagu

quote: Man always dies before he is fully born.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Fear of death makes us devoid both of valour and religion. For want of valour is want of religious faith.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Liberty for wolves is death to the lambs.
author: Isaiah Berlin

quote: It is neccessary to have wished for death in order to know how good it is to live.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: The appeal of cinema lies in the fear of death.
author: Jim Morrison

quote: Death is delightful. Death is dawn, The waking from a weary night Of fevers unto truth and light.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Life itself is but the shadow of death, and souls departed but the shadows of the living.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: There are certain people that are marked for death. I have my little list of those that treated me unfairly.
author: Jennifer Lopez

quote: Emigration is no longer a solution; it's a defeat. People are risking death, drowning every day, but they're knocking on doors that are not open.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: As the fly bangs against the window attempting freedom while the door stands open, so we bang against death ignoring heaven.
author: Douglas Horton

quote: And I will show that nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I've always been slightly preoccupied with death or whatever those kind of silly big questions people will tell you to not spend your time worrying about.
author: Conor Oberst

quote: When I first met Alan Parker, who directed 'Angel Heart,' he'd heard so many horror stories about me that he was literally scared to death of me. Right away, he sat me down and said, 'I'm very scared of you. I've heard you're a very bad boy.'
author: Mickey Rourke

quote: Pain is the mind. It's the thoughts of the mind. Then I get rid of the thoughts, and I get in my witness, which is down in my spiritual heart. The witness that witnesses being. Then those particular thoughts that are painful - love them. I love them to death!
author: Ram Dass

quote: People think that by living on some mountainside in a tent and being frozen to death by freezing rain, they're somehow discovering reality, but of course that's just another fiction dreamed up by a TV producer.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: The silver swan, who, living had no note, When death approached unlocked her silent throat.
author: Orlando Gibbons

quote: Who is there that can adequately gauge the greatness of the humility, gentleness, self-surrender, revealed by the Lord of majesty in assuming human nature, in accepting the punishment of death, the shame of the cross?
author: Saint Bernard

quote: I joyfully hasten to meet death. If it come before I have had opportunity to develop all my artistic faculties, it will come, my hard fate notwithstanding, too soon, and I should probably wish it later - yet even then I shall be happy, for will it not deliver me from a state of endless suffering?
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: In India we only read about death, sickness, terrorism, crime.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Man and animals are in reality vehicles and conduits of food, tombs of animals, hostels of Death, coverings that consume, deriving life by the death of others.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: It's not morbid to talk about death. Most people don't worry about death, they worry about a bad death.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: God, who preferred the correction rather than the death of a sinner, did not desire that a homicide be punished by the exaction of another act of homicide.
author: Saint Ambrose

quote: No matter what is happening in life or in the world - war, natural disaster, poor health, pain, the death of loved ones - if existence is filled with art, music and literature, life will be fulfilling, a joy.
author: Karen DeCrow

quote: In classical times, it was a capital offense to speculate upon the hour of a king's death or upon the identity of his successor.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Many people assume the diseases that kill us are pre-programmed into our genes. High blood pressure by 55, heart attacks at 60, maybe cancer at 70, and so on... But for most of the leading causes of death, our genes usually account for only 10-20 per cent of risk.
author: Michael Greger

quote: Old age is a tyrant, who forbids, under pain of death, the pleasures of youth.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Some of us can be examples about going ahead and growing, and some of us, unfortunately, don't make it there, and end up being examples because they had to die. I hit rock bottom, but thank God my bottom wasn't death.
author: Stevie Ray Vaughan

quote: Faithfulness to the past can be a kind of death above ground. Writing of the past is a resurrection the past then lives in your words and you are free.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: I mean, death is a serious thing, certainly not to be sneezed at.
author: Morrissey

quote: I want to see the U.S. wiped out. Death to the U.S.
author: Bobby Fischer

quote: My old man taught me a lot of stuff in his death that I don't even know if he would have been able to teach me had he been alive. And that was to never do stuff that can jeopardize the people you love and hurt them.
author: Freddie Prinze, Jr.

quote: Following Michael Brown's death, I went to Ferguson and met with his parents. I stood with them as they tried to hold their heads high and deal with both their immense loss and the larger issues of police-community relations.
author: Al Sharpton

quote: The first memory I have in the world is of death and tears. That is how I would mark the beginning of my life: the way people mark the end of one. My family had gathered at Papa Joe's house because Mam' Grace was slipping away, only I didn't register it that way. For some reason I thought that it was her birthday.
author: Charles M. Blow

quote: Does not the very word 'creative' mean to build, to initiate, to give out, to act - rather than to be acted upon, to be subjective? Living photography is positive in its approach, it sings a song of life - not death.
author: Berenice Abbott

quote: Life is doubt, and faith without doubt is nothing but death.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: Beauty is a precious trace that eternity causes to appear to us and that it takes away from us. A manifestation of eternity, and a sign of death as well.
author: Eugene Ionesco

quote: Death never takes the wise man by surprise, he is always ready to go.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: For those who live neither with religious consolations about death nor with a sense of death (or of anything else) as natural, death is the obscene mystery, the ultimate affront, the thing that cannot be controlled. It can only be denied.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: The charm of fame is so great that we like every object to which it is attached, even death.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: A belief in hell and the knowledge that every ambition is doomed to frustration at the hands of a skeleton have never prevented the majority of human beings from behaving as though death were no more than an unfounded rumor.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Our law is a Jordanian law that we inherited, which applies to both the West Bank and Gaza, and sets the death penalty for those who sell land to Israelis.
author: Yasser Arafat

quote: Fads are the kiss of death. When the fad goes away, you go with it.
author: Conway Twitty

quote: Rock and menopause do not mix. It is not good, it sucks and every day I fight it to the death, or, at the very least, not let it take me over.
author: Stevie Nicks

quote: I am not the born how can there be either birth or death for me?
author: Guru Nanak

quote: Agitate! Agitate! Ought to be the motto of every reformer. Agitation is the opposite of stagnation - the one is life, the other death.
author: Ernestine Rose

quote: Saddam's fate should be in the hands of his country men. They were the major victims of his brutal reign and should decide his life, death, or permanent imprisonment. Personally, I would lock him away forever.
author: Ronnie James Dio

quote: We were then in a dangerous, helpless situation, exposed daily to perils and death amongst savages and wild beasts, not a white man in the country but ourselves.
author: Daniel Boone

quote: To live without risk for me would be tantamount to death.
author: Jacqueline Cochran

quote: Had it not been for slavery, the death penalty would have likely been abolished in America. Slavery became a haven for the death penalty.
author: Angela Davis

quote: I am reconciled to my death, but I detest the mode.
author: John Andre

quote: Sleep is lovely, death is better still, not to have been born is of course the miracle.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: I think that we should be eternally vigilant against attempts to check the expression of opinions that we loathe and believe to be fraught with death, unless they so imminently threaten immediate interference with the lawful and pressing purposes of the law that an immediate check is required to save the country.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: The death penalty is being applied in the United States as a fatal lottery.
author: Bianca Jagger

quote: To be immortal is commonplace; except for man, all creatures are immortal, for they are ignorant of death; what is divine, terrible, incomprehensible, is to know that one is immortal.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: I have thought there was some advantage even in death, by which we mingle with the herd of common men.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: There's nothing wrong in suffering, if you suffer for a purpose. Our revolution didn't abolish danger or death. It simply made danger and death worthwhile.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: I have two luxuries to brood over in my walks, your loveliness and the hour of my death. O that I could have possession of them both in the same minute.
author: John Keats

quote: For children preserve the fame of a man after his death.
author: Aeschylus

quote: The writer crafts their ideal world. In my world, everyone has really long conversations or just picks apart pop culture to death and everyone talks in monologue.
author: Kevin Smith

quote: In Seattle, I soon found that my radical ideas and aesthetic explorations - ideas and explorations that in Richmond, Virginia, might have gotten me stoned to death with hush puppies - were not only accepted but occasionally applauded.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: Of course, we avoid death. To know something is inevitable is one thing. To accept, to truly feel it... that's different.
author: Michael Haneke

quote: Libertarians know that a free country has nothing to fear from anyone coming in or going out - while a welfare state is scared to death of poor people coming in and rich people getting out.
author: Harry Browne

quote: India made a big mistake by signing up to TRIPS. With a population of 1.3 billion, India can't afford a monopoly in healthcare. Monopolies lead to higher prices and we can't allow them in a country like India with so much poverty and misery. It was like signing our own death warrant.
author: Yusuf Hamied

quote: If you look at the beginning of this country, when the pilgrims came to this country, the first year they had a communistic experiment. They said, 'OK, we're going to take the land, we're going to work the land together and share in the fruits of our labor.' They almost starved to death. Almost half of them died that first year.
author: Rafael Cruz

quote: A filmmaker doesn't have to suffer to show suffering. You just have to understand it. You don't have to die to shoot a death scene.
author: David Lynch

quote: Nixon was a bad loser. He hated losing worse than death, and that is why I enjoyed him. We were both football fans, both addicts; and on some days, nothing else mattered.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: Even though everybody's lives are different, in general we're all human beings, and we go through the same things: disappointments, the pleasures of life, life and death. That's always been a really big part of the show to me, making sure the audience feels connected, and that carries through to the album.
author: Joan Jett

quote: I am profoundly fascinated by cruelty, fear, horror and death. My films show my preoccupation with violence, the pathology of violence.
author: Fritz Lang

quote: The obvious objections to the execution of Saddam Hussein are valid and well aired. His death will provoke violent strife between Sunni and Shia Muslims, and between Iraqis in general and the American occupation forces.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: I feel about aging the way William Saroyan said he felt about death: Everybody has to do it, but I always believed an exception would be made in my case.
author: Martha Beck

quote: For me, since I have a life wish, not a death wish, for me, I was not gambling my life. I was doing something much more beautiful. I was carrying my life across.
author: Philippe Petit

quote: I think if 'The Narrow Road To The Deep North' is one of the high points of Japanese culture, then the experience of my father, who was a slave laborer on the Death Railway, represents one of its low points.
author: Richard Flanagan

quote: We hear tears loudly on this side of Heaven. What we don't take time to contemplate are the even louder cheers on the other side of death's valley.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: The amount of death terror experienced is closely related to the amount of life unlived.
author: Irvin D. Yalom

quote: Prior to penicillin and medical research, death was an everyday occurrence. It was intimate.
author: Katherine Dunn

quote: Statistics are the triumph of the quantitative method, and the quantitative method is the victory of sterility and death.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Everything that gets born dies.
author: Morrie Schwartz

quote: You've never seen death? Look in the mirror every day and you will see it like bees working in a glass hive.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: In order to speak about all and to all, one has to speak of what all know and of the reality common to us all. The sea, rains, necessity, desire, the struggle against death... these are things that unite us all.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Once writing has become your major vice and greatest pleasure, only death can stop it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: If someone were to say that life at hard labor is as painful as death and therefore equally cruel, I should reply that, taking all the unhappy moments of perpetual slavery together, it is perhaps even more painful, but these moments are spread out over a lifetime, and capital punishment exercises all its power in an instant.
author: Cesare Beccaria

quote: I'm not afraid to die.
author: John Wooden

quote: Death is the cure for all diseases.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: I detest life-insurance agents: they always argue that I shall some day die, which is not so.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: I had seen birth and death but had thought they were different.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Death is a very dull, dreary affair, and my advice to you is to have nothing whatsoever to do with it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: The words of a dead man are modified in the guts of the living.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Some men are alive simply because it is against the law to kill them.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Love and death are the two great hinges on which all human sympathies turn.
author: B. R. Hayden

quote: Birth and death we all move between these two unknowns.
author: Bryant H. McGill

quote: Dying is easy, it's living that scares me to death.
author: Annie Lennox

quote: Grumbling is the death of love.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: The gods conceal from men the happiness of death, that they may endure life.
author: Lucan

quote: A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn it can be stabbed to death by a quip and worried to death by a frown on the right man's brow.
author: Ovid

quote: Biography lends to death a new terror.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: When you break up, your whole identity is shattered. It's like death.
author: Dennis Quaid

quote: On the plus side, death is one of the few things that can be done as easily lying down .
author: Woody Allen

quote: Success is like death. The more successful you become, the higher the houses in the hills get and the higher the fences get.
author: Kevin Spacey

quote: Pain and death are part of life. To reject them is to reject life itself.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: The greatest men of a nation are those it puts to death.
author: Ernest Renan

quote: Birth was the death of him.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Though it be in the power of the weakest arm to take away life, it is not in the strongest to deprive us of death.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: I'm not afraid of death. It's the stake one puts up in order to play the game of life.
author: Jean Giraudoux

quote: A useless life is an early death.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: The passion of hatred is so long lived and so obstinate a malady that the surest sign of death in a sick person is their desire for reconciliation.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Your body must become familiar with its death - in all its possible forms and degrees - as a self-evident, imminent, and emotionally neutral step on the way towards the goal you have found worthy of your life.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Death is the veil which those who live call life; They sleep, and it is lifted.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: The valiant never taste of death but once.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Men should be bewailed at their birth, and not at their death.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: We are all of us resigned to death: it's life we aren't resigned to.
author: Graham Greene

quote: I believe that fear of life brings a greater fear of death.
author: David Blaine

quote: When I listen to music, I don't want to hear about flowers. I like death and destruction.
author: Jonathan Davis

quote: I saw also that there was an ocean of darkness and death, but an infinite ocean of light and love, which flowed over the ocean of darkness.
author: George Fox

quote: The death penalty, I think, is a terrible scar on American justice, especially the concept of equal justice under law, but also of due process. And it goes state by state, and it's different in different states.
author: Burke Marshall

quote: Nothing is more dreadful in life than the profound thought that death may only greet you with eternal nothingness.
author: Kim Elizabeth

quote: Death is the only pure, beautiful conclusion of a great passion.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: I do not care so much for the death of my gunner, as for other passages of my voyage, for I have good friends in England that will bring me off for that.
author: William Kidd

quote: Death gives meaning to our lives. It gives importance and value to time. Time would become meaningless if there were too much of it.
author: Ray Kurzweil

quote: When the courts decide that murderers, rapists, and others who maliciously break our social contract deserve health care that most working Americans can't afford, they are condemning good people to death.
author: Tammy Bruce

quote: The coward sneaks to death the brave live on.
author: George Sewell

quote: I think about death a lot, like I think we all do. I don't think of suicide as an option, but as fun. It's an interesting idea that you can control how you go. It's this thing that's looming, and you can control it.
author: Ryan Gosling

quote: An insatiable appetite for glory leads to sacrifice and death, but innate instinct leads to self-preservation and life.
author: Jose Marti

quote: Many cats are the death of the mouse.
author: Kaspar Hauser

quote: Life comes to the miners out of their deaths, and death out of their lives.
author: Mary Harris Jones

quote: Death is a very important part of life.
author: GG Allin

quote: Nothing in life is certain except death, taxes and the second law of thermodynamics.
author: Seth Lloyd

quote: There is nothing glamorous about death.
author: Roger Moore

quote: Death remains about the one certain fact in the lives of each one of us, and there will be suffering, sorrow, and sadness next week as there was last week.
author: Basil Hume

quote: Today she is the lady of death, which I believe is the best muse to have.
author: Kit Williams

quote: All I want is a gentleman. I'm sick to bloody death of bastards.
author: Katie Price

quote: I came face to face with death at thirteen years old.
author: Ryan White

quote: The American people know that every day 3,000 kids begin to smoke, 1,000 of them die an early death. They're not going to allow us to go forward this year and not have comprehensive bipartisan legislation. It's in everybody's best interest.
author: Erskine Bowles

quote: Death is very often referred to as a good career move.
author: Buddy Holly

quote: Dying before dying has two important consequences: It liberates the individual from the fear of death and influences the actual experience of dying at the time of biological demise.
author: Stanislav Grof

quote: Oh eyes, no eyes, but fountains fraught with tears; O life, no life, but lively form of death; Oh world, no world, but mass of public wrongs.
author: Thomas Kyd

quote: The life of men and women is so cheap and property is so sacred. There are so many of us for one job it matters little if 146 of us are burned to death.
author: Rose Schneiderman

quote: What are you gonna do, talk the alien to death?
author: James Cameron

quote: I was blessed with a birth and a death, and I guess I just want some say in between.
author: Ani DiFranco

quote: You haven't lost anything when you know were it is. Death can hide but not divide.
author: Vance Havner

quote: Don't be afraid to feel as angry or as loving as you can, because when you feel nothing, it's just death.
author: Lena Horne

quote: Other states are trying to abolish the death penalty... mine's putting in an express lane.
author: Ron White

quote: I now bid farewell to the country of my birth - of my passions - of my death a country whose misfortunes have invoked my sympathies - whose factions I sought to quell - whose intelligence I prompted to a lofty aim - whose freedom has been my fatal dream.
author: Thomas Francis Meagher

quote: It is a sign of creeping inner death when we can no longer praise the living.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: When death has you by the throat, you don't mince words.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: To die for one's country is such a worthy fate that all compete for so beautiful a death.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: To some extent I liken slavery to death.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Well, there's a remedy for all things but death, which will be sure to lay us flat one time or other.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Not even old age knows how to love death.
author: Sophocles

quote: Each instant of life is a step toward death.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: The miser, starving his brother's body, starves also his own soul, and at death shall creep out of his great estate of injustice, poor and naked and miserable.
author: Theodore Parker

quote: The slave is doomed to worship time and fate and death, because they are greater than anything he finds in himself, and because all his thoughts are of things which they devour.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Let us eat and drink neither forgetting death unduly nor remembering it. The Lord hath mercy on whom he will have mercy, etc., and the less we think about it the better.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: All stories interest me, and some haunt me until I end up writing them. Certain themes keep coming up: justice, loyalty, violence, death, political and social issues, freedom.
author: Isabel Allende

quote: To be clear, climate change is a true 800 pound gorilla in the room. The effects of global warming threaten global environmental upheaval over the coming century. But for South Florida and the Everglades, it could be our death knell if urgent action is not taken.
author: Debbie Wasserman Schultz

quote: Patrick Henry did not say, 'Give me absolutely safety or give me death.' America is supposed to be about freedom.
author: John Stossel

quote: I'm not in favor of the death penalty. But I'm in favor of locking these people away in maximum security units where they can never get out. They can never escape. They can never be paroled. Lock the bad ones away. But you gotta rethink everybody else.
author: John Grisham

quote: My mother's death put me in touch with my most savage self. As I've grown up and come to terms with her death and accepted it, the pieces of her that I keep don't exist materially.
author: Cheryl Strayed

quote: It's not the normal way to look at things but I experienced death at a really young age and because of that it's been part of my mental landscape that death is really very possible.
author: Cate Blanchett

quote: Death is the ultimate enemy - and I find nothing reproachable in those who rage mightily against the dying of the light.
author: Stephen Jay Gould

quote: And I love Evander Holyfield to death!
author: Ray Lewis

quote: For me it was a lot harder to come to terms with the death of my grandfather than it was to come to terms with what's happened to the former Yugoslavia.
author: Tea Obreht

quote: There are some people who walk into a room and they oxygenate it, by their very being there's fresh air. Then there are those who come in with the smell of death and they suck the life out.
author: Peter Mullan

quote: I'm 64 years old and, yeah, I went through a transition in my life last year, with the death of my son, that woke me up to a lot of things. You know, I'm perfectly happy in my own little groove. Marching along, building my company, and you know, a happy person.
author: Carl Paladino

quote: The good news is that even though we walk through this valley of death, we don't have to fear, at least not for ourselves! Unfortunately, there is no way to skip over the valley altogether, we must face death and the evidence of evil all around us. But there will come a day... And what a day that will be!
author: Ted Dekker

quote: Death, the real simile for disease - for when we are ill, do we not always feel like we are dying, even if it's only a little? - remains, despite our secularism, the most metaphoricised phenomenon of all.
author: Will Self

quote: You may have gathered that I am not the most cheerful of revellers - some characterise me as the death and soullessness of any party but it wasn't always so, believe me.
author: Will Self

quote: Meditation on inevitable death should be performed daily. Every day one should meditate on being carried away by surging waves, falling from thousand-foot cliffs, dying of disease.
author: Yamamoto Tsunetomo

quote: At the end of our lives, we step across the threshold or death and enter into a new and better world. I believe that. It's just that simple.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: If you look in general at people who live in anarchy, they have quite high rates of death from either homicide or warfare or both. Anarchy is one of the main reasons for violence, and it may be the most important.
author: Steven Pinker

quote: What I'm after is not living to 1,000. I'm after letting people avoid death for as long as they want to.
author: Aubrey de Grey

quote: Am I a trance medium? No. Have I got a gift psychically? Absolutely not. But I believe in the survival of consciousness after death.
author: Dan Aykroyd

quote: My mother's death brought me to my knees. She was my hero, my role model, my very best friend. I spoke to her every single day of my life. I really tried hard when I grew up to make her proud of me.
author: Maria Shriver

quote: I think it's very dangerous, the idea of celebrity - you have to be constantly controversial to maintain the status of celebrity. Reality TV is the death of entertainment - it's just mindless TV but popular because of its voyeuristic nature, and people are very voyeuristic.
author: David Suchet

quote: Even if we mortgage the next 100 years of generations of human beings, we would not have enough energy to build a Death Star.
author: Michio Kaku

quote: Real heroes are those who face death for a principle - say, to save the lives of others - without any promise of reward.
author: Alan Dershowitz

quote: I'm interested in time, fame, death, beauty, truth, all those things.
author: Marianne Faithfull

quote: At the time of his death, John Kennedy had a national security establishment that was a writhing ball of snakes.
author: Charlie Pierce

quote: I am more interested in how people interpret the phrase 'Elect The Dead' than what I may or may not have intended. I named the album after the track, which is a spiritual song about love, life and death and is the heaviest song on the album without having any heavy instruments.
author: Serj Tankian

quote: When you have closed the Bible, you have neither closed God's mind nor shut God's mouth. God continues to speak, live and exist. I think we should consult the living God for the living word for living people dealing with death, destruction and despair in the midst of our hurt humanity. I believe love will conquer all.
author: Michael Eric Dyson
